summary: Oscar, re: Immerse Melodies mod
Slikey, re: user asking if only one license is needed to host servers
mainText: 'Correct, you need one game license for all your game servers. You don't need multiple game licenses for multiple servers - a single one will be sufficient to get your downloader and servers authenticated. Extra details very soon.'

summary: Slikey, re: giving Game Service Providers Hytale 1-2 days before release to prepare hosting
mainText: 'It won't be functional before launch as it requires authentication. Sorry. We don't have a way to give GSPs early access to production patchlines.'

summary: Slikey, re: user wondering why more companies don't do what Hytale is
mainText:
'It's because it leads to a high stress environment with live operations that means you need customer support, legal, business, accounting, etc. etc. So many moving parts that is very hard to learn and maintain.
We have done this for 14 years, so it's not new.'

summary: Slikey, re: Chayzur saying the Team giving modders access early was good
mainText: 'I am sure that we will also see a lot of third-party documentation arise from this. Those mods will be available as examples that other modders can look at. It is a great kickstart to modding in Hytale.'

summary: Simon shares Slikey's thread on working with community to prepare Hytale
mainText: 'Read üßµ üëá'

summary: Simon, re: Mod Stability
mainText:
'I hope some modders can give more details about how mod stability is for them. @Buuz135mods maybe? 

Generally right now mod stability was not a goal we indexed on as we wanted to make fast progress. However my understanding is that mods still rarely broke.

I even heard of mods that were started at the very beginning and remained functional even until today despite all the work going on.

Once we actually put effort into proper deprecation and more abstracted / easy to use APIs we should see some mods that won't require updates for years.'

summary: Slikey, re: user thanking everyone involved for getting Hytale ready to launch in a couple of months
mainText:
'> game ready to launch
Nothing is every ready to launch :D That's why its important to just launch.'

(Links to Simon's June 28th, 2025 statement where he stated the goal was 'Just Launch.')

summary: Slikey, re: at what point Vanilla Hytale would be unlikely to be seen in the wild
mainText:
'Up to our designers. This isn't some committee decision. Strong game direction is done by a strongly opinionated game designer who knows the game and is open to feedback.
I think that too many games fail as they try to follow a cookbook to make a good game. There is no recipe.'

summary: Slikey, re: Modders and Business Partners
mainText:
'And just so much more.. Hundreds of small features / fixes and improvements were handled this way.

This is who we are. We work with feedback. When we select Early Access as our release strategy, we don't just do it to finally give players access, but because we need it to stay efficient and on target. 

It also makes rolling over into the post-launch much easier. We already have the live mindset and our workflows have users in them. 

It's far from relaxing but it's the way to actually make progress. This is easy for many small projects with few users but we are doing this at viral scale. You will have a front-row seat to transparent development that you will rarely see at such scale.'

summary: Slikey, re: Modders and Business Partners
mainText: 'Builders: We used Hypixel internal and external builders to validate that our creative tools are actually usable. Usually we play the game in exploration mode but without skilled builders we wouldn't have been able to reach our EA goals in our creative tools'

summary: Slikey, re: Modders and Business Partners
mainText: 'Everyone: We needed to stand up an authentication & account system in record time. Having so many people involved, we could discover any weird edge-case that would have worked internally. We didn't get away with any impact to auth as users would start complaining.'

summary: Slikey, re: Modders and Business Partners
mainText: 'Dedicated Servers / GSPs: We initially made the launcher and downloaded updates that way. GSPs brought up that they can't really use the launcher to download server updates automatically. So we made a headless CLI "hytale-downloader" that will deal with server & asset updates. Allowing self-hosters to automate their server updates.'

summary: Slikey, re: Modders and Business Partners
mainText: 'Modders: We worked with our "asset directory" which worked fine for us. When modders got their hands on the game, they started modding. However now when we updated the game, the patcher crashed as they had local changes. So we just made a good mods workflow.'

summary: Slikey, re: Modders and Business Partners
mainText:
'I am so grateful for the modders and business partners we worked with during the past few months. Without them we wouldn't be able to release next week.

Why is that? This team is a team that works best in a live environment. We needed to emulate that as fast as possible. How we do that? We actually get users. 

It was too early to open the game to the public but we asked some brave companies and individuals to sign up for the most ambitious launch they will ever experience. Some brave souls embarked on this journey with us and and offered us incredible support. 

We are getting immediate feedback and work on actual pain. Every work item is automatically validated to be (1) valuable and (2) correct. 

Giving some examples for some actual things:'

summary: Simon, re: user asking why post the Machinima video if it's not representative of current state
mainText: 'It's still a great in-game animation, very fun. I figured I would share what the tools were once capable of. No reason to vault it; people put time and effort into it.'

summary: Simon releases disclaimer for Machinima video
mainText:
'DISCLAIMER for the Hytale machinima at 10 AM EST

Recorded in-game. Not a representation of actual gameplay, lore and no longer a representation of what the current state of machinima tools can do. It was created and recorded a few years ago.

The good news is that we plan to rebuild the machinima tools after the early access launch! I strongly believe it is critical that we achieve great machinima tools accessible to everyone.

It's a fun one, see you all at 10 AM EST.'

summary: Thomas, re: user asking if creepy/scary creatures will exist
mainText: 'Yes, huge fan of scary things myself hehe'

summary: Thomas, re: if all creatures will have a purpose eventually
mainText: 'Some wildlife will be more for flavor, like cute birds or insects üòå'

summary: Thomas, re: last tweet
mainText: 'How do we come up with this : we research, explore, concept, discuss ideas, Come up with prototypes and decide to give it a chance. In the past 10years many creatures have been added anyway without proper game design goal but this will change'

summary: Thomas, re: creature design
mainText: 'Yes art team "mostly" decided how creatures look like, but it's also a conversation with design and Simon depending on game design needs. Some creatures are outdated and lack a bit of oompf, but we will keep improving them so don't get tooooo attached to some oldies haha'

summary: Thomas, re: chaos
mainText: 'I wouldn't say that chaos is my comfort tho haha. It's only sustainable for a short amount of time'

summary: Thomas, re: user wanting to present original concept for Hytale
mainText: 'Is it ideas you want to share to the Hytale team? You can use Twitter, or the official Hytale discord in fan art channel'

summary: Thomas, re: his feelings as Hytale approaches
mainText: 'For me, it's similar to Simon, it's in final sprints I'm the most determined and focused. It's when there is no plan, no control, no vision, no transparency that I'm getting anxious and feel pressured..which isn't the case right now.'

summary: Buddha, re: his day to day

chaos is comfort'
